title: Create consoul.web module with FastAPI integration helpers
description:
**As a** backend developer
**I want** ready-to-use FastAPI integration helpers and Pydantic models
**So that** I can quickly build HTTP/WebSocket endpoints with Consoul

**Context:**
ChatGPT analysis (lines 2239-2395) recommends FastAPI as the standard backend framework for Consoul web integration. Need production-ready helpers for:
- HTTP POST /chat endpoint
- Pydantic request/response models
- Error handling middleware
- Session management utilities

This module should NOT be a full framework, just thin helpers that wrap Consoul SDK for web use. LangChain, not Consoul, handles orchestration.

**Technical Notes:**
- Create: src/consoul/web/__init__.py
- Create: src/consoul/web/models.py (Pydantic models)
- Create: src/consoul/web/endpoints.py (FastAPI helpers)
- Dependencies: fastapi, pydantic (optional - extra group)
- Pattern: Thin wrappers, not opinionated framework
- Align with: ConsoulResponse model (src/consoul/sdk.py:44-77)
- HTTP contract: {"messages": [...], "model": "...", "stream": false}
- Response: {"content": "...", "tokens": 0, "model": "...", "usage": {...}}

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** I have FastAPI installed with consoul[web]
**When** I import from consoul.web
**Then** I can access ChatRequest, ChatResponse Pydantic models

**Given** I create a POST /chat endpoint
**When** I use create_chat_handler() helper
**Then** it returns a FastAPI route handler that processes chat requests

**Given** a client sends ChatRequest JSON
**When** the endpoint processes it
**Then** returns structured ChatResponse with content, tokens, model

**Given** an error occurs during processing
**When** an exception is raised
**Then** returns proper HTTP 500 with error details in standard format

**Given** I need session management
**When** I use get_or_create_session() helper
**Then** retrieves or creates isolated Consoul instance for session_id

**Testing Considerations:**
- Test FastAPI endpoint integration (TestClient)
- Test Pydantic model validation
- Test error responses (400, 500)
- Test with actual Consoul SDK
- Test session helpers
- Mock LangChain model responses

**Implementation Hints:**
- Pydantic models align with SDK types:
  - ChatRequest(messages: list[ChatMessage], model: str, stream: bool)
  - ChatResponse(content: str, tokens: int, model: str, usage: dict)
  - ChatMessage(role: Role, content: str, id: str)
- Helper pattern: def create_chat_handler(consoul: Consoul) -> Callable
- Error handling: FastAPI HTTPException with details
- Session storage: Dict[str, Consoul] (in-memory, Redis for production)
- Optional dependencies: pyproject.toml [web] extras
- Reference: ChatGPT ProtoStack backend design (lines 2026-2395)
- Example: examples/backend/fastapi_basic.py
